info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 6:04AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected around Boulder City, Lake Mead National Recreation Area and far east Henderson. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended over the area. However, minor flooding of some streets and low-lying area may still be occuring. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inch of rain fell within the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... East Henderson, Boulder City, Las Vegas Bay, Lake Las Vegas, Boulder Beach, Boulder Beach Campground, Railroad Pass and Las Vegas Bay Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
